text: [Music]
authenticity is not an automatic
uninhibited process you know it is
strategic and authentic disclosure
should be aligned with purpose so as I'm
talking to leaders in organizations
about how they can become more authentic
you know I always caution them against
the advice that they just need to be
themselves you know is it's just that
simple
just be yourself just know what you
stand for and stand by those values no
matter what when the reality is we have
multiple facets of ourselves we house
will have competing two competing
commitments and so we have to make
decisions on the basis of our priorities
in any given scenario so when I'm
working with leaders to develop
frameworks for increasing authentic
engagement I develop those frameworks
around the concept of the moment of
truth which is the strategic opportunity
that calls your identity and cause your
values into question and offers an
invitation for you to then you know
reveal and act upon those values in a
way that will create positive outcomes
for your organization some members of
organizations because of status power
and privilege are allowed more degrees
of freedom to deviate whereas lower
status lower power marginalized members
of organizations their actions are much
more tightly constrained within the
prescribed norms of that culture so that
where deviance is coded by a high power
high privileged individual as creative
expression deviance is coded by low
power low privilege or marginalized
individuals as defiance
and that then creates an oppositional
dynamic between one's valued cultural
expressions and the norms and
expectations of the organization so
organizations have to be quite mindful
of the bandwidth for innovation and
creativity for people ability to bring
in different ideas and different
perspectives that express who they are
and what they value and that can be
engaged as resources for the
organization to anchor in on a
generative possibility that bridges
identity and authenticity is the
paradigm of best self engagement
